Recto: in Persian, Padsha shahjahan (Catherine Asher 2/8/13)

Revision 6/5/2015 from C. Asher: Can really only make out Shah jahan.  Might read Shah jahan sabay koran (title of Timur).

Verso:

Untranslated devanagari inscription in black ink     

Illegible devanagari inscription in faded blue ink 

At bottom, handwritten in pencil: Under large. / D.N.G
medium: Opaque watercolor and gold on paper
text: This posthumous portrait of the Mughal ruler Shah Jahan (r. 1628-58) probably would have been kept in an album, along with other illustrations of nobility wearing their finest silks.  Foreign visitors collected these albums as souvenirs and exchanged portraits as symbols of political alliances.
title: Portrait of Shah Jahan
